citeinfo.origin: National Atlas of the United States and the U.S. Geological Survey
citeinfo.title: United States Cities and Towns, 2022

descript.abstract: U.S. National Atlas Cities represents cities and towns in the United States.
descript.purpose: U.S. National Atlas Cities provides information about the locations, names, features, types, populations, and elevations of cities and towns for geographic display and analysis on national and large regional scales.

cntinfo.cntinst:
In the United States– Direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing and consulting services to your local Esri Regional Office. For support, contact Esri by telephone (voice) between 5:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. Pacific time, Monday through Friday, by dialing +1-888-377-4575; facsimile (fax) available at +1-909-792-0960; or visit https://support.esri.com/; Esri holidays excluded. Email and chat are available through the Support page on My Esri (https://my.esri.com).
Outside the United States– Direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing, sales, support, and consulting services to your local Esri Office. This information can be found at https://www.esri.com/en-us/contact#c=us&t=0. For other questions or comments, you may contact Esri headquarters by email, telephone, or fax or write to us.

dataqual.logic: The dataset is converted to file geodatabase (FGDB) format using tools in ArcGIS. The geometry is checked, and if needed repaired.
dataqual.complete: After processing, the dataset is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials.

horizpa.horizpar: The data should be displayed and analyzed at scales appropriate for 1:1,000,000-scale data. The horizontal positional accuracy is unknown.

citeinfo.origin: National Atlas of the United States and the U.S. Geological Survey
citeinfo.title: USGS Small-scale Dataset - Cities and Towns of the United States 201403 Shapefile

srcinfo.srccitea: National Atlas of the United States®

citeinfo.origin: U.S. Department of Commerce, Census Bureau

serinfo.sername: Substantial Changes to Counties and County Equivalent Entities: 1970-Present

pubinfo.publish: U.S. Department of Commerce, Census Bureau

srcinfo.srccitea: Changes to Counties or County Equivalent Entities: 2010s

procstep.procdesc: The following steps were performed by Esri: Downloaded the compressed file from the National Atlas of the United States and extracted it. Projected the data to WGS 1984. Removed unneeded fields. Renamed source field FEATURE2 to STATUS and calculated its value “-999” to blank. Changed the codes and names of three counties: 1) Bedford (independent) city, Virginia (51-515) - Changed to town status and added to Bedford County (51-019). 2) Kusilvak Census Area, Alaska (02-158) - Changed name and code from Wade Hampton Census Area (02-270). 3) Oglala Lakota County, South Dakota (46-102) - Changed name and code from Shannon County (46-113). Converted the dataset into a file geodatabase.

enttyp.enttypd: The points represent cities and towns in the United States. A city or town is a place with a recorded population, usually with at least one central area that provides commercial activities. Cities are generally larger than towns; no distinction is made between cities and towns.
enttyp.enttypds: National Atlas of the United States and the U.S. Geological Survey

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: An identification number assigned by the Geographic Names Information System (GNIS) to the city or town. This number can be used to link cities and towns in this dataset with GNIS.
attr.attrdefs: National Atlas of the United States and the U.S. Geological Survey

edom.edomvd: No GNIS identification number is available.
edom.edomvds: National Atlas of the United States and the U.S. Geological Survey

attr.attrdef: An identification number assigned by the U.S. Census Bureau to the city or town. This number can be used to link cities and towns in this dataset with the Census Gazetteer data.
attr.attrdefs: National Atlas of the United States and the U.S. Geological Survey

edom.edomvd: No Census Bureau identification number is available.
edom.edomvds: National Atlas of the United States and the U.S. Geological Survey

attr.attrdef: The type of feature of the city or town.
attr.attrdefs: National Atlas of the United States and the U.S. Geological Survey

edom.edomvd: A statistical area delineated locally specifically for the tabulation of Census Bureau data (i.e., census designated place, census county division, unorganized territory, and various types of American Indian/Alaska Native statistical areas). Distinct from Civil and Populated Place.
edom.edomvds: U.S. Geological Survey, United States Board on Geographic Names

edom.edomvd: A political division formed for administrative purposes (i.e., borough, county, incorporated place, municipio, parish, town, and township). Distinct from Census and Populated Place.
edom.edomvds: U.S. Geological Survey, United States Board on Geographic Names

edom.edomvd: A place where there is or was human activity; it does not include populated places, mines, or dams.
edom.edomvds: U.S. Geological Survey, United States Board on Geographic Names

edom.edomvd: A city or town found in local sources but is not in either GNIS or the Census gazetteer.
edom.edomvds: National Atlas of the United States and the U.S. Geological Survey

edom.edomvd: A place or area with clustered or scattered buildings and a permanent human population (i.e., city, settlement, town, and village). A populated place is usually not incorporated and by definition has no legal boundaries. However, a populated place may have a corresponding "civil" record, the legal boundaries of which may or may not coincide with the perceived populated place. Distinct from Census and Civil classes.
edom.edomvds: U.S. Geological Survey, United States Board on Geographic Names

attr.attrdef: The status of the city or town.
attr.attrdefs: National Atlas of the United States and the U.S. Geological Survey

edom.edomvd: City serves as the seat of the national government of the United States.
edom.edomvds: National Atlas of the United States and the U.S. Geological Survey

edom.edomvd: City serves as the seat of the state government.
edom.edomvds: National Atlas of the United States and the U.S. Geological Survey

edom.edomvd: City serves as the seat of both the state government and the county government.
edom.edomvds: National Atlas of the United States and the U.S. Geological Survey

edom.edomvd: City serves as the seat of the county government.
edom.edomvds: National Atlas of the United States and the U.S. Geological Survey

attr.attrdef: The name of the city or town.
attr.attrdefs: National Atlas of the United States and the U.S. Geological Survey

attrdomv.udom: There is no predetermined set of official names for cities and towns that are not in GNIS.

attr.attrdef: The 2010 population of the city or town. Locations with a population of 0 are listed as such in the Census source data.
The county or county equivalent name where the city or town is located.

codesetd.codesetn: Names for the Identification of Counties and Equivalent Areas of the United States, Puerto Rico, and the Insular Areas

attr.attrdef: The code (three-digit number) for the county or county equivalent where the city or town is located.

codesetd.codesetn: Codes for the Identification of Counties and Equivalent Areas of the United States, Puerto Rico, and the Insular Areas

attr.attrdef: The two-letter abbreviation for the state where the city or town is located.

codesetd.codesetn: Codes for States, the District of Columbia, Puerto Rico, and the Insular Areas of the United States

attr.attrdef: The code (two-digit number) for the state where the city or town is located.

codesetd.codesetn: Codes for States, the District of Columbia, Puerto Rico, and the Insular Areas of the United States

attr.attrdef: The elevation of the city or town in meters.
attr.attrdefs: National Atlas of the United States and the U.S. Geological Survey

attr.attrdef: The elevation of the city or town in feet.
attr.attrdefs: National Atlas of the United States and the U.S. Geological Survey
